Magellan Cloud Subsidiary Secures ₹3.61 Crore CCTV Surveillance Contract from Central Railway
Magellan Cloud Limited's wholly owned subsidiary Provigil Surveillance Limited has secured a ₹3.61 crore contract from Central Railway, Nagpur Division for comprehensive CCTV surveillance system deployment. The project involves RDSO-compliant Full HD IP cameras, NVRs, and complete infrastructure at level crossing gates in the Narkher–Chandur Bazar section, with a 9-month execution timeline. Managing Director Joseph Sudheer Reddy Thumma highlighted this as a strong endorsement of the company's capabilities in managing complex railway safety systems.

 Magellanic Cloud Limited announced a significant business development as its wholly owned subsidiary Provigil Surveillance Limited has been awarded a Letter of Acceptance (LoA) from Central Railway, Nagpur Division. The contract, valued at ₹3.61 crores, involves comprehensive CCTV surveillance system deployment and represents a notable addition to the company's railway infrastructure portfolio.
Contract Details and Scope
The awarded contract encompasses the complete supply, installation, testing, commissioning, and maintenance of CCTV surveillance systems at manned, non-interlocked Level Crossing gates within the Narkher–Chandur Bazar section of the Nagpur Division. The project specifications include RDSO-compliant Full HD IP CCTV cameras, network video recorders (NVRs), power and communication infrastructure, complete system integration, and associated civil and electrical works.

Technical Specifications
The surveillance system deployment involves advanced technology components designed to meet railway safety standards. The RDSO-compliant Full HD IP CCTV cameras will be integrated with network video recorders to ensure comprehensive monitoring capabilities at the designated level crossing gates. The project also includes establishing robust power and communication infrastructure to support the surveillance network operations.
Management Commentary
Global CEO & Managing Director Joseph Sudheer Reddy Thumma noted that this partnership represents a "strong endorsement" of the company's ability to manage complex, high-reliability safety systems in sensitive environments. The contract demonstrates the company's expertise in railway infrastructure and surveillance technology deployment.
Corporate Compliance
The company confirmed that none of the promoter, promoter group, or group companies have any interest in Central Railway, the entity that awarded the contract. Additionally, the order does not fall within the purview of related party transactions, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements under SEBI guidelines.
Project Execution Framework
The 9-month execution timeline encompasses all phases from initial supply through final commissioning and maintenance setup. The comprehensive nature of the contract includes both technical deployment and civil works, positioning Provigil Surveillance Limited as a complete solution provider for railway surveillance infrastructure projects.
